Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: descompoñer

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From des- +‎ componer.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /deskompoˈneɾ/ [d̪es.kõm.poˈneɾ]
  • Rhymes: -eɾ
  • Syllabification: des‧com‧po‧ner

Verb

[edit]

descomponer (first-person singular present descompongo, first-person singular preterite descompuse, past participle descompuesto)

  1. (transitive and reflexive) to decompose, rot
  2. (transitive and reflexive) to discompose, unsettle
  3. (reflexive) to break down

2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
